articleinfo.title: The Linux Documentation Project Weekly News

listitem.para: Ari Mäkelä published v2.0.29 of the Finnish HOWTO, with more on OpenOffice on Debian and th choice of fonts.

The v1.3 of the Samba Authenticated Gateway, by Ricardo Alexandre Mattar, has extended information on how to update your firewall configuration as users connect, including a link to a script that spares you the work of implementing this feature yourself.
Howard Shane announces new models and new drivers in v1.6 of the Webcam HOWTO.
Getting a bit old-fashioned but still wide-spread: IRC. In his HOWTO Frédéric L.W. Meunier describes the basics and available Linux applications.
Kurt Swendson asked to archive the existing version of the Beowulf HOWTO and to replace it with this completely revised document.

Peter Bieringer did a checkup of the IPv6 IPsec section in v0.48 of his Linux + IPv6 HOWTOBryan Henderson put something about the 2.6 kernels in his Module HOWTO and also added info about the dangers of unloading modules.
Linux MIPS HOWTO:
Ralf Bächle announced the replacement of the Linux MIPS HOWTO by a wiki. He is looking for advise on translation of the document.
XML Editors and conversions:
Saqib Ali is working on a list of XML editors categorized by WYSIWYG, WYSIWYM and Text based. Secondary categorization is done by deviding the editors in Freeware, OpenSource and commercial groups.
Recently we got a couple of documents written in OpenOffice, which needed to be converted to DocBook XML. There are a couple of possibilities to get there:
First convert the file to HTML using OO features, then optionally run it through tidy and then through html2db.
There is a tool which is called OOo2dbk and that can eb downloaded here.

sect1.title: The LDP/LDPWN mini-HOWTO
sect1.para: The Linux Documentation Project (TLDP) is working on developing free, high quality documentation for the GNU/Linux operating system. If you want to help TLDP, consider joining discuss-subscribe@en.tldp.org (a low volume discussion mailing list). You can also send your suggestions to feedback@en.tldp.org.

The LDP Weekly News is compiled, edited and published by Machtelt Garrels (Tille) and Y Giridhar Appaji Nag (Giri) with help from several other people. To receive this newsletter weekly in your mailbox, subscribe to the news-subscribe@en.tldp.org mailing list. Back issues are available at http://tldp.org/ldpwn.

Help us create this newsletter. We need volunteers who follow the community (mailing lists, newsgroups, web channels) and report events related to free software documentation. Write to us at feedback@en.tldp.org.
